Entries.default: "Though possessed of our own names - our own eyes and minds - we have united in purpose."
"I wish to see you returned to your proper place, but the other Faces conspire against us."
"Who are you, exactly?"
"Whehami seeks to escape... but you do not? Why?"
"I need to help these souls."
"I endured the remainder of my life in this inhospitable place - a very long life - all of it spent as nature would will it."
"Leave this place? How then would I serve Toamowhai?"
"Whehami's grip on the flow of souls must be loosened. After that... Well, you are a Watcher."
"If not, then the Slaying Face will certainly understand violence. Indeed, I'm sure he'd prefer it."
"I'll see what I can do."
"I'll uh... get right on that."
"Take your time. It is only the fate of Kazuwari - and your soul - in the balance."
"Where am I?"
"Whehami shattered the spine of souls. Now, those who perish in the Crucible do not move on to meet the Wheel."

"Toamowhai guide your hunt."

Erūke's form blurs into a soft light and departs towards the southwest.
"I came to this island when I was very young. It was a time of chaos and suffering throughout the Deadfire."
"Why should I trust anything you're telling me?"
"I am Whehami's chosen. Perhaps he will listen to me."
"Perhaps your arrival is the hunter god's reply."
"This is Toamowhai's domain - one of the great hunter's many dens in the Beyond."
"How did the Slaying Face destroy the 'flow of souls?'"
"His strength is rivaled only by his stubbornness, but I hope he will consider your words."
"Trust is for prey. But ignore my words, and you will remain here forever."
"Though you could not walk there from here, you are, in a fashion, still on Kazuwari."
"Answer some questions for me, I'm still trying to make sense of this."

Crowned in a stylized boar helm, a starved and sinewy aumaua kneels in quiet contemplation. All manner of scars and burns festoon their arms, and stringy, unkempt hair dribbles from the collar of their helmet.
"It would be stranger if all of this seemed normal to you. How may I enlighten?"
"We are within the heart of the Crucible. The Pool of Memories was simply the entry."
"Are we inside the Pool of Memories?"
"If this is Toamowhai's realm, where is Toamowhai?"
"Exactly how many of you are in here?"
"What exactly do you do here that serves your god?"
"I've heard enough."
"Do you not see his ribs, his eyes, his blood? This place is Toamowhai." Erūke spreads out their arms, their head titled back.
"His presence surrounds us. Listen, and you will hear his roars and purrs."
"All who die in the Crucible pass through this place, but only the three of us - Whehami, Aexica, and I - remain to honor the hunter god."
"No. Always the three of us. I can't recall a time without the others."
"Were there other 'Faces' before you arrived?"
"Perhaps Whehami believes he can burden you with his role as the Slaying Face and escape this place."
"Our task is to sing the Crucible into action, providing the means for a true contest of skill."
"So when Humaire spoke of the souls being out of harmony, she was sensing the three of you squabbling?"

"I suspect she sensed the disruption in the flow of souls after Whehami... Made his mark."

Erūke points to the fractured adra pillar.
"I fear the slow death of this place - or the wrathful return of Toamowhai - should the spine remain broken."
"I'm your champion - need me to crush this slayer fool next?"
"Every slayer must meet its match eventually. Perhaps Whehami's time is nigh."
"But his wrath has served Toamowhai well, and it will serve him in kind."

"Watcher."

Erūke's head lowers slightly in greeting.
"I believe Aexica has manipulated Whehami in a bid to escape."
"Let me out, or I'll start destroying all of you until I'm free."
"Whehami seems certain that this ends with either me trapped or in bloodshed. Help me convince him otherwise."
"Wait a moment, I'll be back."
"Where would I go?"
"The Slaying Face is nothing if not predictable."
"I am left with little choice but to destroy Whehami."
"Though we are united in service of Toamowhai, I fear that for the Crucible to survive, this must be done."
"I fear this course of action, but you are my chosen, and I will put my faith in your resolve."
"That would explain Whehami's sudden onset of long-term plotting."
The spirit shakes their head.
"I assure you, champion, that killing me will not get you closer to escape."
[Attack] "I tire of this."
"So be it."
With a bellowing war cry, the aumaua spirit charges you.
"Sorry about your pig."
"My pig? Ah. Watchers oft see the past and present of souls muddled as one. I- I appreciate the condolence."
"You fight with the fury of Toamowhai in all his forms."

Erūke points to what at first appear to be a stalactite and stalagmite of adra, nearly touching. The chunks of essence-rich stone floating around it leave little doubt this was once a singular pillar.
"I'm sorry, I don't care about your problem, I just want to get out of here."
"Your escape and my desire to restore this place are one and the same."
"If you are trying to figure out where you are, the closest answer is that your soul resides within the statue of the Faces of the Hunt."
"Since Whehami damaged the pillar, I have spotted momentary glimpses of other souls - lost, wayward, and transient."
"To meddle would defeat this place's purpose. How can we say the best hunter is the best if the hunt is staged?"
"And it is in Whehami's nature to smash whatever is presented to him as a problem without asking questions."
"I am Toamowhai's will to survive. I am not Toamowhai's calm temperance."
"Perhaps conflict is inevitable, but I beseech you to seek another route."
"The three of you arrived at the same time, yet you were each alive at vastly different times. I believe you are all a single soul awakened to your own past lives."

"If we share the same soul, that would mean..."

The aumaua soul taps at their chin in thought.
"It would mean any attempt by any one of us to escape is both unlikely to work and likely end in our ruin."
"My chosen, the others must be made to understand that we survive together or we perish as one."
"We have become fractured, turned upon ourselves." Their head hangs.
"I will not flee from the duty of maintaining this sacred place."
"Live well, Champion of the Hunt."
"Thank you, Watcher. I assumed this would end in destruction, but I am glad to be wrong."
"Repair the flow of souls and the way will open for you."
"I wish to know more of this place."
"I need to know more about you and the others who dwell in this place."
"Toamowhai's realm is not easily understood. Ask, and I will attempt to explain."
"Then ask, and perhaps I can lead you to clarity."
The soul sits almost motionless, awaiting your questions in tranquil silence.
The soul sits almost motionless, awaiting your questions in tranquil silence.
"You have endured what few others might, my chosen. I am Erūke, the Surviving Face. It is good to finally meet you in person."
"I am Erūke, the Surviving Face. I wish that I could welcome you under better circumstances."
"Why have you brought me here?"
"I invited you here that the others wouldn't. That you would arrive unblinded and unfettered."
"It was not me who lured you here." They raise a single bony finger in correction.
"The others would use you to escape this place. They mistake it for a prison."
"To leave this place, you must subdue him. His desecration must be undone."
"How would I return to the Here?"
"Here, the souls of those who fought and died in his honor may rest until the time of need, when Toamowhai will absorb their cunning, and feast on their might."
"This place exists within and beneath its great statue. From here, we oversee the Crucible games."
"Whehami, the Slaying Face, has destroyed the flow of souls."
"I would prefer that be prevented."
"Now I am as you see me - the most enduring of the Faces of the Hunt."
"What are the Faces of the Hunt?"
"We are talons shared upon one clawed hand."
"We serve Toamowhai and care for his Crucible."
"It seemed utter madness to violate this place. But now I know he longs to escape. Or perhaps only to avenge himself on Toamowhai."
"They clog this place, or they linger above. Regardless, they wail and rage."
"End Whehami's stranglehold on the flow of souls, and you can swim it back to the surface."
"Galawain actually warned me away. He sent you a giant lizard instead."
"Then he has decided to punish us all. Strange to have so little time, after having had so much."
"I hope that you know more of these things than I do and can repair the damage the Slaying Face has wrought."
"He chose me to embody his will to survive - and it is a role I shall proudly enact for all eternity."
"Aexica, the Seeking Face, also resides in this place. She may know how best to handle Whehami."
"But since the shattering of the spine of souls, he has grown quieter."
"Though we conjure opponents for the contest, we do not control them, nor interfere in battle."
"Think that means we can summon up a fight?"
"Wait, we ain't a talking statue too, now, are we?"
"You were there, weren't you? You saw the great cataclysm which swallowed Ukaizo?"
"That don't exactly explain things."
"By not being stuck within a statue."
"Pretty sure this one's not telling you the whole truth, Watcher." Konstanten narrows his eyes, scrutinizing Erūke.
"I imagine this will continue until the souls can properly return to the Wheel."
"I assumed such a thing impossible but... he is determined to try."
"Right fitting title for you, aye cap?"
"Clearly the lad ain't never met you, cap."
"She was a good friend, but only the first of many I outlived."
"Consider attempting reason, even if Whehami's nature will likely force a conflict."
"I never saw Ukaizo, child. Only the storms and the mad sea and the beasts driven to frenzy."
The soul sits almost motionless, awaiting your questions in tranquil silence.
"Whehami corrupted the flow of souls, not I."
"When you're ready, I will be here."
With a single fluid motion, the old aumaua rises to their feet.
The spirit raises an eyebrow.
"I suspected the same thing, Watcher." Ydwin nods.
"Di verus. Three distinct minds manifested from a single potent soul."
"That'd explain why they're all a pain in the ass." Konstanten grimaces.

"Unfortunately, I have little reason to believe Whehami will accept this."

He sighs.
"The others must be saved from, well, ourselves, as it were."
"Given our connection, and mine with the Faces, I believe we can bring all into accord."
"Speak with Whehami. Help him see the truth. I will influence him from within."
"There may be some way to appeal to his pride, however."
"It is easy for me to endure this duty, but it is in Aexica's nature to seek, to aspire."
"I think you have seen through Aexica's web. But will Whehami accept it? Without her confession, I fear not."
"Still, I am thankful for your intervention, albeit deeply ashamed of our conflict."
"The Crucible games shall be as eternal as the seasons and the oceans, and each year the Pool of Memories will grow deeper with stories of battle."
"All that remains is for the flow of souls to be restored with the Tooth of Toamowhai. With that done, you should be able to leave this place."
"Then the Seeking Face has found her end. She will return, in time. But not before you have moved on."
"Then the Slaying Face is slain. For the moment, at least. He cannot escape this place so easily."
"Live well, Champion of the Hunt."
"Do what must be done.""
"What will you do now?"
"Aexica attacked me."
"What should I do with this tooth?"
"You knew she had other plans for Whehami. Apparently she had some for you, too."
"Strange. I wonder why. Perhaps there was more to it than we knew."
"Rare even were other kith. Sometimes I thought myself the last aumaua in the world."
"Great. Glad to see we all learned something here."
"Yeah, yeah, we're real impressive. So who in Magran's name are you?"
"If the Faces got free of their statue, we'd be unleashing a three-headed monster on the Deadfire."
"...But that might bring the bloodshed in the Crucible to an end, too." He chews on a thick knuckle, looking away.
"A straightforward enough reply." Her arms crossed, she stares down at the old aumaua spirit.
"Such is the nature of endings, never truly believed until they arrive."
"Unless you've learned to expect them." He coughs quietly.
"Starting to get the feeling, cap, that this god of theirs be a fat bit of hornswaggle made up to fit whatever boots they need it to."
"As are they all, bon aimico."
"How convenient."
"Wonder if this is what those souls all reaped up by Gaun feel like."
"Sure, never heard that one before." Konstanten rolls his eyes and sighs.
"And Whehami's to be the dumb brute you bludgeon folks with. Cute."
"Ain't so bad with you here." Reaching forward, she squeezes your hand.
"Don't go straining your buoy-hollow head trying, farmer."
They lift a metallic shard from the dissipating corpus of Whehami and press it into your hands.
